cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles E of Antigua and 185 miles ESE of Barbuda
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the northern Leeward Islands, then toward the Bahamas and south Florida late this week-end
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys / extreme south Florida coast near Sunday morning

weather_observation.watch_coast: None posted yet for the U.S. coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: None posted yet for the U.S. coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast from the Keys northward to at least the Space Coast is in the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Strong tropical-storm to potentially hurricane-force winds possible Sunday with highest risk for 50-kt gusts (26% cumulative probability) and a 13% chance of 64-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge of at least 3–6 ft possible along the southeast Florida coast and inlets if the current track persists.
weather_observation.rainfall: Torrential rain bands could deliver 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential in the Fort Lauderdale area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning late week; seas building well ahead of the center could force early port closures.
